Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: First, I need to identify which cases are violating the normative rules. The normative process is strict, so any steps that don't follow the sequence or violate the ordering rules are violations.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Looking at the event log, case 2 has a problem. The third event in case 2 is the Risk Assessment, but there's no prior Credit Check. The normative says that Credit Check must occur before Risk Assessment. So this is a violation. Also, the order is violated here.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Then, the user mentioned that if the loan is rejected, you shouldn't finalize documentation before closing. But in case 2, they do finalize documentation after closing. Wait, case 2's loan is rejected, so they shouldn't finalize before closing. But in the log, they do finalize, which is allowed. Wait, no. The problem says if loan is rejected, do not finalize documentation before closing. So if the case is rejected, you shouldn't finish the documentation before closing. But in case 2, the loan is rejected, and they do finalize documentation after closing. That's a violation. So case 2 is a violation.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - NE
Text: For case 3, they had a Credit Check that happened more than 24 hours after the application. The normative says Credit Check must occur before Risk Assessment. But here, they did Risk Assessment first. So that's a violation. Also, the timeline for case 3 is after 24 hours, which is a desideratum violation. So case 3 is a violation.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Now, part 2: Identify which cases fail to meet the desiderata conditions. The desiderata include timing recommendations and a follow-up call. Looking at the event log, case 2's follow-up call is not done. So that's a violation.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3 also has a follow-up call missing. But case 3's timeline is after 48 hours, which is a desideratum violation. So case 3 fails to meet the desiderata.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Wait, but in part 1, case 2's violation is the credit check not occurring before risk assessment. Also, the loan decision is approved, so finalizing documentation before closing. But in case 2, the decision is rejected, so they shouldn't finalize before closing. But in the log, they do finalize after closing. That's a violation.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - NE
Text: Similarly, case 3 has a rejection, so they should not finalize before closing, but they do, which is a violation.

Name: Validation - NE
Text: So summarizing: Part 1: Cases 2 and 3 are violating the normative rules. Case 2 has a missing credit check before risk assessment and a violation in finalizing documentation after rejection. Case 3 has a violation in credit check time and a desideratum violation in the timeline.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Part 2: Cases 2 and 3 fail to meet the desiderata conditions. Case 2 lacks a follow-up call, and case 3 has a missing follow-up call. Also, case 3's timeline is after 48 hours, which is a desideratum violation.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now, for part 3, when possible, suggest interpretations. For example, in case 2, the missing credit check could indicate a rushed process, or the credit check was incomplete. For case 3, the timeline issue might suggest that the credit check was delayed. The desiderata violations could be due to insufficient follow-up calls to ensure alignment.

Name: Validation - IND
Text: I need to make sure I'm not missing any cases. Let me check again. The event log has case 2 with Risk Assessment first, which violates the order. Case 3 has Credit Check after 24 hours, which is a desideratum violation. So yes, those are the violations.
